channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: VLM-Grounder: A VLM Agent for Zero-Shot 3D Visual Grounding
item.description: 3D visual grounding is crucial for robots, requiring integration of natural language and 3D scene understanding.

item.title: Looking Inward: Language Models Can Learn About Themselves by Introspection
item.description: We study introspection by finetuning LLMs to predict properties of their own behavior in hypothetical scenarios.

item.title: Learning Graph Quantized Tokenizers for Transformers
item.description: Transformers serve as the backbone architectures of Foundational Models, where a domain-specific tokenizer helps them adapt to various domains.

item.title: Efficient Function Placement in Virtual Networks: An Online Learning Approach
item.description: We propose a model for the virtual function placement problem and several novel algorithms using ideas based on multi-armed bandits.

item.title: Deep Generative Models Unveil Patterns in Medical Images Through Vision-Language Conditioning
item.description: Deep generative models have significantly advanced medical imaging analysis by enhancing dataset size and quality.

item.title: Unlocking the Capabilities of Masked Generative Models for Image Synthesis via Self-Guidance
item.description: A key factor in the performance of continuous diffusion models stems from the guidance methods, which enhance the sample quality at the expense of diversity.

item.title: EH-MAM: Easy-to-Hard Masked Acoustic Modeling for Self-Supervised Speech Representation Learning
item.description: In this paper, we present EH-MAM (Easy-to-Hard adaptive Masked Acoustic Modeling), a novel self-supervised learning approach for speech representation learning.

item.title: Enhanced Prompt-leveraged Weakly Supervised Cancer Segmentation based on Segment Anything
item.description: To demonstrate the superiority of the proposed method, experimental studies are conducted on histopathological breast cancer datasets.

item.title: Performance of Gaussian Mixture Model Classifiers on Embedded Feature Spaces
item.description: Our first contribution is to investigate GMM based classification performance taking advantage of the embedded spaces CLIP and ImageBind.

item.title: CLaMP 2: Multimodal Music Information Retrieval Across 101 Languages Using Large Language Models
item.description: Challenges in managing linguistic diversity and integrating various musical modalities are faced by current music information retrieval systems.

item.title: Data Defenses Against Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models excel at performing inference over text to extract information, summarize information, or generate additional text.

item.title: RAG-DDR: Optimizing Retrieval-Augmented Generation Using Differentiable Data Rewards
item.description: Our experiments on various knowledge-intensive tasks demonstrate that DDR significantly outperforms the SFT method, particularly for LLMs with smaller-scale parameters that depend more on the retrieved knowledge.

item.title: ORSO: Accelerating Reward Design via Online Reward Selection and Policy Optimization
item.description: Reward shaping is a critical component in reinforcement learning (RL), particularly for complex tasks where sparse rewards can hinder learning.

item.title: ORCHID: A Chinese Debate Corpus for Target-Independent Stance Detection and Argumentative Dialogue Summarization
item.description: Dialogue agents have been receiving increasing attention for years, and this trend has been further boosted by the recent progress of large language models (LLMs).

item.title: DepthSplat: Connecting Gaussian Splatting and Depth
item.description: Gaussian splatting and single/multi-view depth estimation are typically studied in isolation.

item.title: UniDrive: Towards Universal Driving Perception Across Camera Configurations
item.description: We further propose a virtual configuration optimization method by minimizing the expected projection error between original cameras and virtual cameras.

item.title: Diffusing States and Matching Scores: A New Framework for Imitation Learning
item.description: Adversarial Imitation Learning is traditionally framed as a two-player zero-sum game between a learner and an adversarially chosen cost function, and can therefore be thought of as the sequential generalization of a Generative Adversarial Network (GAN).

item.title: MedINST: Meta Dataset of Biomedical Instructions
item.description: The integration of large language model (LLM) techniques in the field of medical analysis has brought about significant advancements, yet the scarcity of large, diverse, and well-annotated datasets remains a major challenge.

item.title: Cliqueformer: Model-Based Optimization with Structured Transformers
item.description: Expressive large-scale neural networks enable training powerful models for prediction tasks.

item.title: PUMA: Empowering Unified MLLM with Multi-granular Visual Generation
item.description: This work represents a significant step towards a truly unified MLLM capable of adapting to the granularity demands of various visual tasks.

item.title: aiXcoder-7B: A Lightweight and Effective Large Language Model for Code Completion
item.description: In this paper, we propose a lightweight and effective LLM for code completion named aiXcoder-7B.

item.title: A Pattern to Align Them All: Integrating Different Modalities to Define Multi-Modal Entities
item.description: The ability to reason with and integrate different sensory inputs is the foundation underpinning human intelligence and it is the reason for the growing interest in modelling multi-modal information within Knowledge Graphs.

item.title: GDeR: Safeguarding Efficiency, Balancing, and Robustness via Prototypical Graph Pruning
item.description: Training high-quality deep models necessitates vast amounts of data, resulting in overwhelming computational and memory demands.

item.title: LoLDU: Low-Rank Adaptation via Lower-Diag-Upper Decomposition for Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning
item.description: However, LoRA utilize random initialization and optimization of low-rank matrices to approximate updated weights, which can result in suboptimal convergence and an accuracy gap compared to full fine-tuning.

item.title: Fairness-Enhancing Ensemble Classification in Water Distribution Networks
item.description: As relevant examples such as the future criminal detection software [1] show, fairness of AI-based and social domain affecting decision support tools constitutes an important area of research.

item.title: UniG: Modelling Unitary 3D Gaussians for View-consistent 3D Reconstruction
item.description: In this work, we present UniG, a view-consistent 3D reconstruction and novel view synthesis model that generates a high-fidelity representation of 3D Gaussians from sparse images.

item.title: SAda-Net: A Self-Supervised Adaptive Stereo Estimation CNN For Remote Sensing Image Data
item.description: Stereo estimation has made many advancements in recent years with the introduction of deep-learning.

item.title: SiamSeg: Self-Training with Contrastive Learning for Unsupervised Domain Adaptation in Remote Sensing
item.description: Semantic segmentation of remote sensing (RS) images is a challenging task with significant potential across various applications.

item.title: Starbucks: Improved Training for 2D Matryoshka Embeddings
item.description: Effective approaches that can scale embedding model depth (i. e. layers) and embedding size allow for the creation of models that are highly scalable across different computational resources and task requirements.

item.title: AutoAL: Automated Active Learning with Differentiable Query Strategy Search
item.description: AutoAL consists of two neural nets, named SearchNet and FitNet, which are optimized concurrently under a differentiable bi-level optimization framework.

item.title: DAWN: Dynamic Frame Avatar with Non-autoregressive Diffusion Framework for Talking Head Video Generation
item.description: To address these challenges, we present DAWN (Dynamic frame Avatar With Non-autoregressive diffusion), a framework that enables all-at-once generation of dynamic-length video sequences.

item.title: Do LLMs Have Political Correctness? Analyzing Ethical Biases and Jailbreak Vulnerabilities in AI Systems
item.description: In this paper, we delve into the intentional biases injected into LLMs for safety purposes and examine methods to circumvent these safety alignment techniques.

item.title: Exploring the Design Space of Visual Context Representation in Video MLLMs
item.description: Then, we explore the scaling effects in frame selection and token selection respectively, and fit the corresponding function curve by conducting extensive empirical experiments.

item.title: Cross-Lingual Auto Evaluation for Assessing Multilingual LLMs
item.description: This would enable benchmarking of general-purpose multilingual LLMs and facilitate meta-evaluation of Evaluator LLMs.

item.title: Ab initio nonparametric variable selection for scalable Symbolic Regression with large $p$
item.description: Symbolic regression (SR) is a powerful technique for discovering symbolic expressions that characterize nonlinear relationships in data, gaining increasing attention for its interpretability, compactness, and robustness.

item.title: Pose-Based Sign Language Appearance Transfer
item.description: We introduce a method for transferring the signer's appearance in sign language skeletal poses while preserving the sign content.

item.title: All models are wrong, some are useful: Model Selection with Limited Labels
item.description: With the multitude of pretrained models available thanks to the advancements in large-scale supervised and self-supervised learning, choosing the right model is becoming increasingly pivotal in the machine learning lifecycle.

item.title: RAMPA: Robotic Augmented Reality for Machine Programming and Automation
item.description: As robotics continue to enter various sectors beyond traditional industrial applications, the need for intuitive robot training and interaction systems becomes increasingly more important.

item.title: Diffusion Curriculum: Synthetic-to-Real Generative Curriculum Learning via Image-Guided Diffusion
item.description: DisCL adjusts the image guidance level of image synthesis for each training stage: It identifies and focuses on hard samples for the model and assesses the most effective guidance level of synthetic images to improve hard data learning.

item.title: Multi-style conversion for semantic segmentation of lesions in fundus images by adversarial attacks
item.description: Our approach enables training a segmentation model with diverse databases while controlling and leveraging annotation styles for improved retinopathy diagnosis.

item.title: Enhancing Dataset Distillation via Label Inconsistency Elimination and Learning Pattern Refinement
item.description: In the final evaluation, our M-DATM achieved accuracies of 0. 4061 and 0. 1831 on the CIFAR-100 and Tiny ImageNet datasets, ranking 1st in the Fixed Images Per Class (IPC) Track.

item.title: Artificial Kuramoto Oscillatory Neurons
item.description: It has long been known in both neuroscience and AI that ``binding'' between neurons leads to a form of competitive learning where representations are compressed in order to represent more abstract concepts in deeper layers of the network.

item.title: Boosting Imperceptibility of Stable Diffusion-based Adversarial Examples Generation with Momentum
item.description: We propose a novel framework, Stable Diffusion-based Momentum Integrated Adversarial Examples (SD-MIAE), for generating adversarial examples that can effectively mislead neural network classifiers while maintaining visual imperceptibility and preserving the semantic similarity to the original class label.

item.title: CCUP: A Controllable Synthetic Data Generation Pipeline for Pretraining Cloth-Changing Person Re-Identification Models
item.description: Cloth-changing person re-identification (CC-ReID), also known as Long-Term Person Re-Identification (LT-ReID) is a critical and challenging research topic in computer vision that has recently garnered significant attention.

item.title: Balancing Label Quantity and Quality for Scalable Elicitation
item.description: Scalable oversight studies methods of training and evaluating AI systems in domains where human judgement is unreliable or expensive, such as scientific research and software engineering in complex codebases.

item.title: signwriting-evaluation: Effective Sign Language Evaluation via SignWriting
item.description: The lack of automatic evaluation metrics tailored for SignWriting presents a significant obstacle in developing effective transcription and translation models for signed languages.

item.title: Fast Estimation of Partial Dependence Functions using Trees
item.description: By estimating PD functions for arbitrary feature subsets, \texttt{FastPD} can be used to extract PD-based interpretations such as SHAP, PD plots and higher order interaction effects.

item.title: MIRAGE-Bench: Automatic Multilingual Benchmark Arena for Retrieval-Augmented Generation Systems
item.description: In our work, we benchmark 19 diverse multilingual-focused LLMs, and achieve a high correlation (Kendall Tau ($\tau$) = 0. 909) using our surrogate judge learned using heuristic features with pairwise evaluations and between GPT-4o as a teacher on the MIRAGE-Bench leaderboard using the Bradley-Terry framework.

item.title: Preference Diffusion for Recommendation
item.description: Recommender systems predict personalized item rankings based on user preference distributions derived from historical behavior data.

item.title: Measuring Free-Form Decision-Making Inconsistency of Language Models in Military Crisis Simulations
item.description: We find that inconsistency due to semantically equivalent prompt variations can exceed response inconsistency from temperature sampling for most studied models across different levels of ablations.
